sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均可表示"整体的一部分"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: part, piece, section, division, portion, fraction, fragment, segment, share
means: part ： 含义广，最普通用词。常指整体中可大可小的一部分，也可指整体中可分开的独立部分。
piece ： 指整体中的一些个体，尤指从某个整体上分出来的一部分。
section ： 指整体中的分区，部分与部分之间有显著界限。
division ： 通常指按类划分或分割成而的部分。常含抽象意义。
portion ： 侧重从整体中所分配到的那一部分，含一定的独立意义。
fraction ： 指包含在全体中的一部分，暗示微不足道的一部分。
fragment ： 指因破裂、分割等产生的支离破碎、不规则的一部分。
segment ： 指某物的特定部分或自然形成的部分，也指线形物品的一段。
share ： 指共有的东西中应占有的一部分。

sentence.Network_en: Villa had just been relegated from the First Division.
sentence.Network_cn: 维拉队刚刚从甲级联赛中降级。

sentence.Network_en: Hibernian clinched the First Division title when they beat Hamilton 2-0.
sentence.Network_cn: 希伯尼安队以2比0战胜汉密尔顿队，夺得了甲级联赛的冠军。

sentence.Network_en: The narrowness of the government's victory reflected deep division within the Party.
sentence.Network_cn: 政府的勉强获胜反映了党内的严重分歧。

jx.jx_en_mean: the assignment of different parts of a manufacturing process or task to different people in order to improve efficiency

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French devisiun, from Latin divisio(n-), from the verb dividere (see divide)

entry.def: The division of a large unit into two or more distinct parts is the act of separating it into these parts.

example.ex: ...the unification of Germany, after its division into two states at the end of World War Two.
example.tran: 二战结束时曾被一分为二的德国实现了统一

entry.def: The division of something among people or things is its separation into parts which are distributed among the people or things.

example.ex: The current division of labor between workers and management will alter.
example.tran: 当前工人与管理部门的分工将会改变。

entry.def: Division is the arithmetical process of dividing one number into another number.

example.ex: I taught my daughter how to do division at the age of six.
example.tran: 女儿6岁时我就教她如何做除法了。

entry.def: A division is a significant distinction or argument between two groups, which causes the two groups to be considered as very different and separate.

example.ex: The division between the prosperous west and the impoverished east remains.
example.tran: 繁荣的西部和贫穷的东部之间的差距仍然存在。

entry.def: In a large organization, a division is a group of departments whose work is done in the same place or is connected with similar tasks.

example.tran: 该银行的拉丁美洲分部

entry.def: A division is a group of military units which fight as a single unit.

example.ex: Several armoured divisions are being moved from Germany.
example.tran: 正从德国调动几个装甲师。

entry.def: In the British Parliament, a division is a vote where the Members of Parliament go into separate rooms in order to record their vote.

entry.tran: (足球等体育运动中联赛的)级
entry.def: In some sports, such as football, baseball, and basketball, a division is one of the groups of teams which make up a league. The teams in each division are considered to be approximately the same standard, and they all play against each other during the season.

example.ex: Villa had just been relegated from the First Division.
example.tran: 维拉队刚刚从甲级联赛中降级。

example.ex: ...the Scottish Premier Division leaders, Dundee United.
example.tran: 苏格兰超级联赛的领头羊，邓迪联队

means.word_mean: 1. an army unit large enough to sustain combat;

sentences.sentence: "two infantry divisions were held in reserve"

means.word_mean: 2. one of the portions into which something is regarded as divided and which together constitute a whole;
3. the act or process of dividing
4. an administrative unit in government or business
5. an arithmetic operation that is the inverse of multiplication; the quotient of two numbers is computed

sentences.sentence: "he played baseball in class D for two years"

means.word_mean: 8. (biology) a group of organisms forming a subdivision of a larger category
9. (botany) taxonomic unit of plants corresponding to a phylum
10. a unit of the United States Air Force usually comprising two or more wings
11. a group of ships of similar type
12. the act of dividing or partitioning; separation by the creation of a boundary that divides or keeps apart

Sentence.sentence: There are 20 officers in the Campus Security Division Their job is to handle crime, accidents lost and found items ,and traffic problems on campus.
Thanks to Joe, I have realized how little basis there is for the social divisions that exist in every community.
Social divisions will break down if people get to know each other

In a division of electronic engineers, who were designing equipments so advanced that they work in teams of up to 150, co-workers and managers were asked to nominate the standouts- the stars in productivity and effectiveness
The division of labor between men and women.
Chris has made several changes for his Division in the past year

sentences.en: A hedge forms the division between her land and mine.
sentences.cn: 有一道篱笆在她和我的土地之间形成了分界线。

sentences.en: Division arose over the interpretation of the idea.
sentences.cn: 对这个观点的解释产生了分歧。

sentences.en: Unequal distribution of wealth may cause division in society.
sentences.cn: 财富分配不均会引起社会分裂。

sentences.en: The Bill was read without a division.
sentences.cn: 该法案未经分组表决即进行宣读。

jushi.english: Division arose over the interpretation of the idea.
jushi.chinese: 对这个观点的解释产生了分歧。

jushi.english: She works in the company's export division.
jushi.chinese: 她在该公司的出口科工作。

jushi.english: The river forms the division between the old and new parts of the city.
jushi.chinese: 这条河是该城新旧两区的分界线。
